attributes.additional_details:
A decent home is fundamental to people’s well-being.
Despite Britain being one of the richest countries in
the world, many people live in accommodation that is
run-down, overcrowded or dangerous. Others have
lost their homes altogether - shelter

At that time of the year when the christmas tree comes down and everyone's in their warm cosy homes, we know that someone's out there freezing cold, alone and hungry - Werewolf Bootcamps
attributes.background:
The successful, Inspiring, world leaders Christopher McCann & Brett Harding at Werewolf Bootcamps felt emotionally compelled by love and compassion to start this petition to end homelessness in Bristol.

Please sign the petition so men, women and children no longer have to go through this ordeal.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Homelessness and housing in Bristol is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here: 

http://epetitions.bristol.gov.uk/epetition_core/
